podcastContent: 敦煌壁画常常画这张画，就是维摩诘和文殊的对话。但我自己喜欢这一部经，常常抄这一部经，所以我觉得里面的对话好精彩。因为文殊菩萨进来了，到了病房就问说，诶，你是一个修行的人，那修行的人怎么会生病呢？你不是应该修行的这个程度已经很高了，你应该到了不生病的状况。那维摩诘就回答说：从师有爱，则我病生八个字，我常常写这8个字送朋友，我们知道痴情的痴这个字，就是理应知道不应该做的事，可是我情不自禁，我还是会做，从痴有爱，那我们也觉得很有趣，菩萨到底应不应该有爱，如果有爱是不是也有恨。就我觉得他触碰到大乘佛学非常惊人的部分，就从痴有爱则我病生，所以我生病，那文殊菩萨就问他，那你什么时候病会好。他说一切众生病好，我的病也就好。这个时候我们忽然发现维摩诘讲的病，不是一般的病，是说他承担了所有众生之病，我们知道这是大乘佛学。我们有一天知道一个人的修行到一定的程度，那个不关心是因为他有更高的关心。他会看到所有在现实里的争吵之上，应该有一个更为亲明的东西。所以我们常读到无无明，对无明的一种堪悟，能够有更大的了悟的可能。这是为摩皆经一直要传达的。

analysis.contentEssence: 以“病”为慈悲的容器：从情爱的牵连而生病，并将个人病痛扩展为对众生苦的共同承担与觉悟。
analysis.physicalMetaphor: 一盏灯芯被油浸透后微微发热冒烟：热与烟不是故障，而是把周围的冷与暗一起吸纳进来，直到整间屋子被照亮才渐渐平息。
analysis.metaphorVisualization: 画面中心是一个小而稳定的“灯芯/火种”形体，外圈是被吸入的半透明烟雾与热晕，呈向心汇聚后再缓慢淡出的层叠；烟雾的形不是分区对照，而是围绕核心的“病相”与“光相”共存。

tension.from: “修行人为何会病”的表层矛盾与情爱牵连
tension.to: 以病承载众生之病、以觉悟照见更大的关心

topologicalLayout.zoneCountReason: physicalMetaphor 是“灯芯+热晕烟雾”的同一系统：病与慈悲在同一中心里发生，不需要拆成多个对立区域。
topologicalLayout.divisionMethodReason: 热晕与烟雾天然以中心向外扩散/回旋，最贴合“从一念痴爱而生病、又承担众生苦”的向心—外放结构。

primaryRelationship.typeReason: 灯芯被热晕与烟雾层层包裹，象征“以自身为容器承载众生之病”，不是并列对照而是内外含摄。

rhythmSignature.typeReason: 从“冒烟发热”的扰动逐渐收束为稳定光源，呼应“众生病好，我病亦好”的渐息与回归澄明。

structureParams.tensionExpression: 中心光核保持清晰小尺度稳定形；外层烟雾以半透明回旋纹理制造“病相扰动”；烟雾密度由外向内递减并在最外缘淡出，形成“承担—照见—平息”的张力轨迹。

antiTemplateCheck.howIsThisDifferent: 整体是单域向心的“灯芯被烟雾包裹并渐息”的动态隐喻，用嵌套与层叠表达病与慈悲同体，而非把概念切成两个并列阵营做左右对比。

prompt:
[CANVAS]
- Format: 1:1 square, 1024x1024 pixels, clean vector-like digital art
- Safe margin: 10% padding (all forms stay well inside)
- Whitespace target: 65% (quiet Ma, large calm field)
- Visual weight distribution: centered but not rigid; the smallest, sharpest weight at the core, with increasingly lighter nested fields radiating outward

[TOPOLOGY] — Based on topologicalLayout
- Zone count: 1 (single unified field)
- Division method: radial (energy and matter expand from a single center)
- Zone ratios: 100
- Physical metaphor visualization: depict an oil-soaked wick that heats and smokes; heat and smoke expand from the same center and gradually subside, implying absorption of surrounding cold/darkness until the space feels lit

[RELATIONSHIPS] — Based on primaryRelationship
- Primary relationship type: nested
- Interaction quality: fused
- Spatial expression: a tiny crisp core is wrapped by two translucent veils and one smoke ribbon; each layer partially overlaps and fuses through transparency, never becoming separate regions

[RHYTHM]
- Rhythm type: decelerating
- Element count: 4
- Interval/size variation: four nested elements with reminder spacing that increases outward (inner layers tighter; outer layer farther and lighter), indicating settling and calming

[GEOMETRY]
- Primary shape (1): a very small vertical wick-ember capsule at center (about 3–4% of canvas width), slightly rounded corners, crisp edge
- Secondary shapes (2–4): 
  1) an inner heat veil: an irregular soft oval around the core (tight radius)
  2) a smoke swirl ribbon: one continuous, semi-transparent spiral-like stroke that rotates around the core (not a perfect circle), with thickness subtly tapering; keep it calm and slow, like a gentle eddy
  3) an outer halo ring: a very faint, larger soft field that dissolves into background near the edge of its radius
- Lines: 1 max, used only as the smoke ribbon stroke (no diagonal divider lines, no framing)
- Edge treatment: gradient-fade edges; outermost edges feather out smoothly
- Negative space: dominant; smoke and halos occupy less than half the canvas, leaving spacious calm

[COLOR]
- Background: cool-mist (#F5F7FA)
- Primary hue: clear-cyan (#E0F7FA), used for halos and smoke translucency
- Secondary hue (temperature contrast within warm-cool strategy, still extremely subtle): a near-neutral warm tint used only inside the inner heat veil at very low opacity (keep saturation under 32%, very high lightness; do not introduce a strong third hue)
- Temperature: overall cool, lucid, awakening; warm-cool contrast is minimal frequency and minimal area
- Contrast method: layering (3 layers via transparency)
- Accent usage: if used, keep to 2–5% area and 10–15% opacity, very faint, to avoid “clever and noisy”

[LIGHTING]
- Light source: implied inner glow from the wick core
- Glow effects: exactly 2 (a tight inner glow and a faint outer halo glow)
- Ambient atmosphere: bright, airy, clarified

[TEXTURE & MATERIAL]
- Surface quality: smooth, paper-like calm (very subtle grain)
- Edge sharpness: core is crisp; all outer forms soften with gentle fade
- Transparency: smoke ribbon and veils are semi-transparent, clean overlaps, no muddy blending

[ATMOSPHERE & MOOD]
- Japanese aesthetic: Ma (spacious), Kanso (reduced), Shibui (restrained)
- Content resonance: vibration and compassion—smoke swirl signifies illness/heat agitation; nested halos signify bearing and illuminating; outward deceleration signifies gradual easing and return to clarity

[STYLE]
- Clean vector-like digital art, no text, no symbols, no UI
- No photorealism, no 3D rendering
- High clarity at 128px thumbnail; the smoke swirl must be clearly readable as a gentle rotation, not replaced by perfect concentric circles.
